title: MCP Governance Security Gateway
subtitle: Enterprise AI Governance Platform
description: Enterprise-scale governance and security platform for Model Context Protocol (MCP) based Agentic AI systems. Designed to convert MCP from a developer-centric protocol into a governed enterprise platform with Zero-Trust security, identity-bound execution, and fine-grained RBAC.
highlights: Identified critical enterprise adoption blockers including lack of identity attribution, over-privileged access models, absence of centralized kill switches, and prompt-injection-driven destructive actions
Conceptualized and architected a centralized MCP Governance Gateway to convert MCP into a governed enterprise platform
Designed Zero-Trust security model where all MCP capabilities are denied by default and explicitly enabled through centralized governance
Implemented identity-bound execution by integrating SAP XSUAA and JWT-based authentication, ensuring every AI action is traceable to a real human user
Designed fine-grained, capability-level RBAC, moving beyond coarse role-based permissions to tool-level and resource-specific authorization
Built multi-tenant SaaS architecture on SAP BTP ensuring strict tenant isolation, enterprise-grade auditability, and forensic-ready centralized logging
Implemented real-time operational kill switch allowing instant shutdown of compromised MCP servers without application restarts
Enabled secure, production-ready adoption of Agentic AI at enterprise scale with governance, accountability, and auditability as first-class capabilities

title: Test Harness for Concur Off RevDb Integration

highlights: Designed comprehensive BDD-driven test automation framework to validate integrations between Salesforce, Oracle BigMachine, SAP Concur, and SAP S/4HANA
Modelled real enterprise business flows using Gherkin feature files, enabling non-technical stakeholders to understand and validate integration behaviour
Implemented Selenium-based browser automation to create Salesforce opportunities and generate quotes in Oracle BMI
Triggered quote submission workflows via SAP APIM and SAP Integration Suite into SAP S/4HANA
Dynamically extracted generated Quote IDs and validated downstream business objects including Solution Quotations, Subscription Items, Subscription Contracts, Contract Account and Business Partners
Integrated framework into Jenkins Declarative Pipelines, enabling automated regression testing, artifact publishing, and early detection of integration regressions
Improved confidence and reliability of highly complex, revenue-critical integrations while reducing manual testing effort
